data.additional_notes:
If it is your first time trying to run an EA Game try this to get the game to login with the EA App.
* Switch to Desktop mode
* Open your web browser and navigate to the [EA Sign In Website](https://signin.ea.com/), and log in.
* Launch the game once from Desktop mode and login with the EA App.

This has worked for me with Titanfall 2, Jedi Fallen Order, Star Wars Battlefront 2, and Squadrons. Only had to do it once for Titanfall 2, and the other games worked out of the box without issues logging in thereafter.

reports_summary: One tester notes that STAR WARS™: Squadrons feels smooth on a Lenovo Legion Go when run at 1280×800 with integer scaling and medium graphics; applying a 48 FPS cap keeps the game in the mid‑40s and steadies frame pacing, while the system draws about 21 W so you can expect around 2–2.5 hours per charge. The consensus from this report is that modest visual settings plus the FPS cap deliver a steady experience without overly draining the battery.
